bug.short_desc: firefox minefield browser freezes on search add-ons page

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.4506.2152; .NET CLR 3.5.30729) Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110403 Firefox/4.2a1pre ID:20110403030449
Did several queries on add-ons page (i.e.< https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/search/). These returned results without incident.
Searched add-ons page for "e-mail," and Firefox 4.2 alpha froze--had to manually stop the Minefield browser in Task Manager, and restart
Reproducible: Didn't try
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Navigate to Mozilla add-ons page: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/?browse=featured 2. Enter a search term (I used "e-mail") 3. Actual Results: The browser froze, and I had to shut it down in the Task Manager and restart manually
Expected Results: THe browser did load the two tabs I had open, but it reverted to the results page of last successful add-ons query (i.e., the term I entered before "e-mail," which was "email" [no dash]).
Default theme

WFM - Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110403 Firefox/4.2a1pre ID:20110403030449
Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
How about with a new, empty profile? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#Make_a_new_profile
